entry.title: Employee Business Partner Archival, Deletion, and Recreation in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Introduction
In SAP, Business Partners (BPs) are central master data objects shared across multiple modules. This blog explains how to safely delete and recreate an Employee Business Partner using a new number range—without affecting the employee record or related applications, while also allowing the old number range to be reused for other Business Partners, such as customers and vendors.

Step-by-Step Resolution
Step 1:  Delete Communication Detail (Infotype 105 Subtype 0001) from Employee
To delete Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30, select the infotype(105) and subtype (0001), then click the Delete icon. For mass deletions, LSMW can be created and used.

Step 2:  Decouple BP and User
Although we deleted the communication details in the previous step, the Business Partner remains connected to the User ID. To disconnect the Business Partner from the User, run the standard program RSUID_REMOVE_FALSE_BP_ASGN in transaction SE38. Enter the User ID in the input field and execute the program. Then, select the record, click "Convert", and choose "Convert to Classic User".

 



Step 2 can only be executed if Step 1 has been completed.If not, you will receive the following error: "No users found in the selected area."

⚠️  After this step, the email address and telephone number will be removed from the user in transaction SU01. To restore this information efficiently, you can use LSMW to perform a mass import of those details.

Step 3:  Set Deletion/Archiving Flag
Go to transaction BUPA_PRE_DA. Enter the Business Partner number in the Business Partner input field. Select the "To be deleted" radio button. Check the boxes for "Can be deleted" and "Can be archived". Select the "Set Flag" radio button. Click Execute.

Step 4: Remove CP (Central Person) and BP (Business Partner) Relationship
The Central Person (CP) is a technical object used to uniquely link an employee’s personnel record (PERNR) to other related objects like User and Business Partner. The Central Person is automatically generated by the system. This is stored in the HRP1001 table.
The relationship between BP and CP is B207. Get the CP ID from the HRP1001 table for the desired Business Partner. This can be deleted using the standard program RHRHDC00.


Step 5: Set Central Block / End of Purpose (EOP)
Prerequisite:

  • ILM configurations must be in place to execute this step.
  • If any changes are made to the Business Partner, the central block cannot be applied on the same day — it must be performed on the following day.
  • If business partner is locked in any applications or open transactions, EOP cannot be executed.

To set central block, go to transaction BUPA_PRE_EOP, Give the business partner ID and execute.

Step 6:  Write Archiving File
Go to transaction SARA and enter CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field. Choose the WRITE option and create a variant.  Provide the Business Partner ID that has to be deleted, set ILM Actions to Archiving, and select the execution mode — either Production or Test.

Once done, click on Attributes at the top and enter a suitable description, then save again. Set the Start Date to Immediate and define the Spool Parameters as LP01. Execute the job, then navigate to Job Overview, open the Spool List, and review the results.

Step 7:  Delete the Archived File
Once the archiving file is written, go to transaction SARA again. Select CA_BUPA in the Archiving Object field and choose the DELETE option. The file created in the previous step will be displayed. Select it and execute the deletion.



Step 8: Set New Number Range
Go to transaction SNRO and set a new number range.

Step 9:  Create Communication Detail (Infotype 105 – Subtype 0001)
To create Infotype 105 (Communication Details) and Subtype 0001 (System User): For a single employee, go to transaction PA30 and create Infotype 105 with Subtype 0001. For mass creation, an LSMW can be created and used.

Step 10:  Run BP Sync Program
Run the BP sync program /SHCM/RH_SYNC_BUPA_EMPL_SINGLE with the desired Employee ID. A new Business Partner will be created and synced with the User.

Conclusion
By following these steps, you can safely delete and recreate Employee Business Partners without terminating any employee records. The End of Purpose (EOP) report helps identify open transactions preventing deletion. Once recreated under a new number range, conflicts are resolved and the old range becomes reusable for other Business Partners.

entry.title: Second Half 2025 Release: What’s New in SAP SuccessFactors HCM?
entry.content:
In today’s business climate, only one thing is certain—change. Whether it’s widening skills gaps, increasing cost pressures, or unexpected disruptions, organizations across all industries are feeling the strain. But with the right strategy and tools in place, HR leaders can confidently navigate this new era of uncertainty and turn every change into an opportunity.

With the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Second Half 2025 Release, we are delivering more than 350 innovations across all solution areas, enabling you to work smarter, move faster, and build a workforce that’s ready for whatever comes next. Here’s a snapshot of what you can expect to see in this release:

 

Drive better people and business decisions

People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud
We are excited to announce the general availability of our new people analytics solution, People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud. This offering empowers organizations to make smarter, faster workforce decisions by unifying SAP and third-party data. Intuitive dashboards and AI-driven insights allow customers to answer critical questions across the employee lifecycle. In this initial release, we are delivering nine pre-built use cases, each designed to unlock insights in a specific HR domain. These include workforce composition, compensation, skills, recruiting, learning, performance, goals, succession, and career development.

Skills and compensation insights

 

Enable agile and compliant HR

New home page
We are launching a completely refreshed home page that provides a more intuitive, efficient, and personalized user experience. A refined layout surfaces timely information and reduces scrolling and clicks, enabling users to complete tasks with ease. Additionally, custom banners allow administrators to create engaging, brand-aligned communications and announcements for targeted audiences, while data visualization cards bring KPIs and metrics directly to the home page. This new experience is initially available as “opt-in” and is supported on both desktop and mobile devices.

New home page on desktop and mobile

 

People Profile Enhancements
We have completed the refresh of the People Profile view experience, incorporating valuable customer input and feedback. This brings us one step closer to the universal release. In addition, customers can now leverage optimized experiences for updating employee information and navigating historical changes. New full-page views enable users to quickly insert, edit, or delete records, further simplifying employee data management.

New edit and history experiences in the People Profile

 

SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling
We are thrilled to introduce a brand-new shift scheduling solution, SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling. Specifically tailored for organizations in manufacturing and other production industries, this solution enables demand-driven workforce planning, supporting both weekly and monthly shift plans that account for operational requirements, employee skills, and labor regulations. By optimizing scheduling and providing clear visibility into workforce availability, organizations can minimize downtime, increase productivity, and better align labor supply with business demand.

SAP SuccessFactors Workforce Scheduling

 

Geofencing in SAP SuccessFactors Time Tracking
In this release, customers can leverage a new geofencing feature that helps ensure employees clock in and out only when physically present at their designated work location. Geofences can be defined for specific groups, with real-time visibility into proximity, helping to improve compliance with location-based policies and prevent time recording outside authorized areas.

Geofencing

 

Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) support in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
Organizations in the United States can now connect with FMLA service providers to automate leave deduction and share inbound data, such as case IDs and dates. This capability helps ensure more accurate leave management, simplifies compliance, and reduces overall administrative effort.

Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) support

 

Create a future-ready workforce

Performance and Goals Agent
A new performance and goals agent offers data-informed coaching for more meaningful conversations and performance reviews. This agent—within the SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals solution—analyzes employee data, such as performance goals, activities and achievements, and continuous feedback, to create a tailored discussion agenda for each employee. Using Joule, managers receive AI-guided insights, including progress summaries, key accomplishments, growth focus areas, and development recommendations. Users can ask follow-up questions to dive deeper into any of these areas.

Performance and Goals Agent

 

Business rules integration in performance management
Business rules can now be used to trigger actions for users based on predefined conditions during the performance review process, such as dynamically exposing a comment field only when a rating condition is met. This standardized review process enhances transparency, reduces bias, and helps ensure that feedback is aligned with organizational policies.

Business rules in performance management

 

Skills-based successor recommendations
Customers can now use AI to quickly identify highly qualified successors by analyzing skills, proficiency levels, and work experiences in employee growth portfolios. This enables greater visibility into potential successors that might have been overlooked using traditional approaches and metrics.

Skills-based successor recommendations

 

People-based model for talent and learning
We are introducing a people-based model across our learning and talent solutions, enabling a more consistent and connected experience for employees and managers. By linking key data, such as learning, skills, and performance, to the individual rather than a specific job role, users benefit from fewer data gaps, more accurate insights, and a more connected and efficient approach to managing growth and development. Whether tracking development or planning succession, all relevant information remains aligned to the person, creating a more complete view of each individual that supports more targeted development and upskilling.

 

Learn more

These are just a few of the many innovations in the SAP SuccessFactors Second Half 2025 Release. To learn more, check out the resources below:

  • Visit the SAP SuccessFactors Product Release & Road Map Information page for release documentation, product videos, and solution area blogs
  • Watch the 2H 2025 Release Highlights Overview Video, featuring Bianka Woelke, GVP Head of Application Product Management
  • Discover all innovations in the What's New Viewer

entry.title: U.S SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603
entry.content:
Section 603 introduces a mandatory Roth catch-up contribution requirement for high-earner employees whose prior year FICA wages exceeded the $145,000 threshold. These legal changes have been addressed by the following SAP Notes:

Main Notes:
3365473 - BEN: SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603:  Note from 2023, introduced the initial changes required for complying with Section 603
3617266 - BEN: Section 603 update for catch-up contributions: Addresses the delivery of the automatic Roth rollover option
3619038 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3617266  
3650369 - BEN: Section 603 Rollover Pre-Tax limit check for 401K and 403B plans: Provides the option to include only pre-tax contributions when assessing the FICA limit for employees who are already contributing to a Roth plan.

Correction Notes:
3654911 - Correction to NOTE_3619038 report :  Addresses an issue within Note 3619038, specifically correcting the report that triggers the error "V_T7USBEN03" | "Could not add to transport request" during manual execution steps.

entry.title: What’s new with SAP Business AI, Joule, and Joule Agents in the SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 release
entry.content:
SAP SuccessFactors’ second half 2025 release represents a major leap forward for AI capabilities across our HCM solutions, beginning with the introduction of our first of many planned AI agents. These agents, led by SAP’s copilot, Joule, mark a pivotal shift in how HR leaders will use artificial intelligence to create more responsive, efficient, and human-centered workplaces. Let’s look at our new AI agent and some other key AI-related highlights in the 2H 2025 release.

Empowering Managers with the Performance and Goals Agent

The newly available Performance and Goals Agent helps managers lead more meaningful performance conversations. By automatically gathering relevant data, from goals and achievements to feedback, Joule delivers personalized discussion points and suggests follow-up actions like scheduling one-on-one meetings or updating goals. This elevates coaching from administrative to strategic, enabling truly continuous performance management. If you want to learn more about the AI agents for HCM announced recently at SAP Connect, please visit this page.

 Joule Integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot

Through its integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot, Joule now connects data and workflows from Teams, Outlook, OneDrive, and SharePoint directly within SAP SuccessFactors. This unified experience reduces the need to switch between systems, letting users complete tasks, retrieve insights, and make decisions directly in the flow of work.

Smarter Pay Transparency with Explain Pay

Employee Central Payroll users in Germany, Mexico, and Brazil can now access the Explain Pay feature in Joule. The capability provides natural-language explanations for pay-related questions, cutting resolution time by up to 50%. This delivers the transparency and trust employees increasingly expect while decreasing HR support load.

Expanding Generative AI Access and Joule Actions

SAP has expanded generative AI availability to private-sector customers in Saudi Arabia, offering AI-assisted writing and goal-setting across HR workflows. The update also broadens Joule Actions, allowing users to upload files, view employer information, access extended time-off data, and create half-day leave requests, all via conversational prompts.

Learn More

In short, the 2H 2025 release of SAP SuccessFactors strengthens the platform’s role as an intelligent, interconnected HR ecosystem that drives productivity, trust, and engagement, all powered by Joule and SAP Business AI. You can discover more 2H 2025 innovations across the suite by checking out the release highlights brochure, overview video featuring Bianka Woelke, and much more on the Product Release & Road Map Information page.

Together, these innovations demonstrate SAP’s vision for an HR future where AI doesn’t just support processes, it redefines them. By embedding agentic intelligence throughout SuccessFactors, SAP gives HR leaders the tools to transform data into action, decisions into impact, and every moment at work into a more connected, individualized experience.
